info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 5:54PM EDT until July 19 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore MD/Washington DC
info.description:
FFWLWX
The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Montgomery County in central Maryland...
* Until 900 PM EDT.
* At 554 PM EDT, Emergency management reports significant flash flooding along the Sligo Creek Watershed. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 30 minutes. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Bethesda, Takoma Park, Chevy Chase, Silver Spring, Wheaton. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bethesda... Langley Park... White Oak... Takoma Park... Adelphi... Kemp Mill... Chevy Chase... North Kensington... South Kensington... Forest Glen... Hillandale... Martin's Additions... North Chevy Chase... Wheaton-Glenmont... Friendship Village... Silver Spring... Wheaton... Calverton... Four Corners... Kensington...
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR BETHESDA, TAKOMA PARK, CHEVY CHASE, SILVER SPRING, WHEATON
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 9:00 PM EDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 9:00 PM EDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR BETHESDA, TAKOMA PARK, CHEVY CHASE, SILVER SPRING, WHEATON
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 9:00 PM EDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 9:00 PM EDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
